text: <!channel>: don't worry about standup, let's just stay head's down since i've had a chance to check in with each of you guys this morning
would be great to meet 5 or so minutes before out 11:30am call though, specifically to make sure i understand if we found anything in the polar api that suggests we need to book by room <@U02E3CRMA>
Just FYI, this could be useful to test forms
<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/imacros-for-chrome/cplklnmnlbnpmjogncfgfijoopmnlemp/related>

attachments.title: iMacros for Chrome
attachments.text: Automate your web browser. Record and replay repetitious work

text: the holland america qa form does not go by room
FWIW
but it does ask you about bed arrangement - i.e. do you want two twin beds or 1 queen bed
weird
joel and i were talking about this just a minute ago, and i'm betting it's more of a business requirement than anything - because if there is a child in a room they need an adult as well
so by entering info on a room by room basis, they can on paper confirm that each room will have at least 1 adult
yeah i am assuming thats what its for
<!channel>: i'm in the echo chamber for our daily call whenever everyone is ready
would be good ot get at least 5 min to catch up before
k be there in a sec
be there in a moment
thanks
whats this “one primary traveler per cabin” business?

not totally sure, sounds like whoever makes the actual booking becomes the primary traveler for the cabin. assuming a child can't be a primary traveler either. since josh has not confirmed if that can be changed later or not it's tough to say if that changes everything
right, but if i am booking two cabins
do i need to specify a PT per room? <@U02E3CRMA>?
melissa joel and i are going to call josh when he's out of this meeting. we'll poke at the primary traveler bit and hopefully have more info to share
<@U026103R3> Looks like I won’t able to stay late tomorrow. Can’t find childcare for that time. Sorry.
What I can do is get here ridiculously early. I wake up at 5 anyways.
ok totally understandable. getting here early would be awesome, and any time that we can dedicate to it would be really appreciated.
question then, would it be possible to work from home during our work session tomorrow evening? wondering if it makes sense to do a virtual work session where we all just keep banging on it from home

topic: Hold their hands when needed. Push them off the ledge when needed.
text: <@U02E3CRMA|joel> set the channel topic: Hold their hands when needed. Push them off the ledge when needed.
#tshirts
In ref to the Joel’s update.
:simple_smile:
<@U0260V1BX>: just heard back from Josh on whether or not the primary traveler can be changed at a later date
sounds like it can't be changed, so the primary traveler always stays the primary
ok
thanks for investigating
so, no real effect on our plans, but josh would like us to note on the page something like *can't be changed
so does that mean that i can’t change the contact info either?
what if i get a new phone or something? or move?
not positive, i'm assuming it's just the person that can't be changed
we can pick at that at a later date
right
other question for you <@U0260V1BX>  - do you know if the limit is 2 rooms for booking? if you max out on the current site the most rooms you can book is 2
not sure what's driving that or if i should just ask josh
oh good question-theoretically i should be able to book up to 6 if all travelers are adults
i should be able to book as many rooms as there are adults
right, ok i'll ask the team
sounds like it affects how we build that out
good catch
